Articles.Content: It has a top speed of 130m/s. After that it will disintegrate.
Actually, forget what I said, here it is moving at 157.5m/s. Notice the strange lack of 'splashes' behind the craft.
I remember my Ekranoplan replica, I always loved that design and theory, It's a great idea but it's weather permitting :/
It's definitely a fun little boat (plane?) and the speed it can get up to is impressive for a 38 ton craft.

Cool boat-planes everyone.

Does anyone want to start a battle? I made some more ships that have much better armor, I have a 45 ton destroyer and a 20 ton corvette. Any suggestions on what size ship I should build next?
It has been incredibly quiet today.
Shocking because I think American schools let out this week, I got out atleast.
Really? it doesn't feel like it. :/

U-boat aiming. origin unknown. available pict: none

Hey Guys, I have been watching this thread for quite a while and I am very impressed with your work and how you were able to cope with so many high-part count warships.

I thought you guys might like to see what I came up with when I decided kerbin needed some defending.

I based it off of the Daedalus from Stargate. It is a monstrosity of over 600 parts and 200 tons. It utilizes basic SRB missiles and has double and tripple layerd armor in some areas. It also has limited amenities for very small fighters in it's two hangar bays. It may look cool but I don't really think it would have much combat effectiveness.

Edited June 1, 2014 by Jon144
Holy **** damn dude that's rediculous!!!!!

AAAAAAH!

*see part count*

*calms down*

Decent part management for a ship of that mass. Impressive part management for a ship of that size. Bring those nacelles in closer and add a warhead of some kind and that ship could be a daunting prospect.

Edited June 2, 2014 by Spartwo

Impressive looking ship, Jon144. Whenever I build something functional it comes out looking like a brick. Also, I'm curious how you all design warheads. Are they powerful enough that a direct hit with an SRB missile is usually a kill?

Here is my new very brick-like battleship, it's around 100 tons.
